msContents.summary: Account of wages to farm laborers delivered for work by Kleon; they were paid at a rate of 2 and 1/4 obols each per day, a higher pay than usual

msItemStruct.note: 51 lines written along the fibers on the front and across the fibers on the back
Large practiced hand; there is some inverted writing that was sponged out: the papyrus was cut off from a larger document

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 43 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Kleon, -- foreman, 6 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 354

div.ab:
The number of hands which Kleon brought down. In Thoth to the 29th, 26 hands, at 2 1/4 obols. Total 9 drachmas 4 1/2 obols. lst---6. He received 10 drachmas. Phaophi 2d-7 hands. 3d-7. 4th-5. 5th-he received 10 drachmas. 7th---8. 8th-8. 9th-8. 10th-8. He received 6 drachmas. 13th-8. 14th-8. 15th-8. 16th-he received 5 drachmas. 8 (hands). 17th-8. 18th-he received 5 drachmas. 7 (hands). 19th-7. 20th- 5. 21st-7. 22d-7. 23d-7. 24th-6. 25th-3. Total 175 (hands) at 2 obols 2 chalkoi is 66 drachmas 3 obols 6 chalkoi. And to him (Kleon) for Thoth, 5 drachmas, and for Phaophi to the 30th, 11 drachmas 1 1/2 obols. Total 82 drachmas 4 1/2 obols. 26th-7. 27th-7. 28th---8. 29th-7. 30th-7.
[Verso:]. lst---8. 2d-6. 3d-9. 4th-6. 5th-7. 7th-9. 8th-10. 9th-7.
